description: Two runs with A/B conditions, testing run concatenation
afni_command: 3dDeconvolve -nodata 200 2 -polort -1 -num_stimts 1 -num_glt 0 -stim_label 1 stim -ortvec baseline_poly_1_1.1D baseline_poly_1_1 -ortvec baseline_poly_1_2.1D baseline_poly_1_2 -ortvec constant_1.1D constant_1 -ortvec constant_2.1D constant_2 -stim_times 1 stim_times.1D GAM\(8.6,0.547\) -TR_times 1 -nofullf_atall -tout -cbucket coefout -bucket statout -jobs 1 -float
execution_output: ++ 3dDeconvolve extending num_stimts from 1 to 5 due to -ortvec
++ Authored by: B. Douglas Ward, et al.
++ -stim_times using TR=2 s for stimulus timing conversion
++ -stim_times using TR=1 s for any -iresp output datasets
++ ** -stim_times NOTE ** guessing GLOBAL times if 1 time per line; LOCAL otherwise
[7m*+ WARNING:[0m '-stim_times 1' file 'stim_times.1D' has 2 rows, but dataset has 1 time blocks
++ Wrote matrix values to file statout.xmat.1D
++ Wrote matrix values to file statout_XtXinv.xmat.1D
++ +++++ Matrix inverse average error = 1.11589e-16  ++ VERY GOOD ++

warnings: AFNI terms are not fully supported in the current event_model pipeline. They are intended for use with AFNI's 3dDeconvolve.
All terms are AFNI terms that don't contribute to the design matrix. Returning empty design matrix.
